metadata.synopsis: Bounty hunter Lewis Gates (Tom Berenger) finds the corpses of three escaped convicts in the wilderness, apparently shot by primitive arrows. Gates and anthropologist Lillian Sloane (Barbara Hershey) follow clues through the mountains to discover a tribe of Cheyenne Indians that has lived in hiding for a century. After the twisted Sheriff Deegan (Kurtwood Smith) uses the violence as grounds for retaliation, Gates must fight to save the Cheyenne from genocide at the hands of a vicious posse.

reviews: This sumptuously photographed outdoor adventure is one of 1995's most pleasant surprises.
Lost Horizon strangely remade as a modern Western, but at least it's not a musical.
Offers a fine exploration of the desire that fuels many dreams of community.
One of those "never heard of it" cable flicks that's actually worth a look.
Even if the movie could have been better -- deeper and more evocative -- it's pretty good just as it is.
... full of one cliche after another and it's extremely predictable. Overall, the problem in the movie is that it takes itself way too seriously.
